title: OutBack Power Showcases Easy-to-Install Solar Equipment for Electrical Contractors
text:
OutBack Power Showcases Easy-to-Install Solar Equipment for Electrical Contractors All-in-one systems designed for longevity in the field save installers time, offer competitive advantage  03   
ARLINGTON, Wash.-  OutBack Power Technologies, Inc. , a designer and manufacturer of advanced power electronics for renewable energy, backup power and mobile applications, will showcase its newest photovoltaic (PV) equipment at the National Electrical Contractors Association (NECA) Convention, Oct. 3 to 6 at Moscone Center South in San Francisco. With the addition of the FLEXpower Radian, new Nano-Carbon batteries and the launch of its Solar Power Stations (SPS), OutBack Power delivers easy-to-install equipment for electrical contractors, saving up to half a day of labor and providing a leg up in serving the growing renewable energy industry. 
“Electrical contractors are seeing a dramatic rise in interest about solar electricity from their customers, and OutBack is responding with solutions that promise longevity, simplified installation, and time and cost savings to support this surging market interest,” said Mark Cerasuolo, marketing director for OutBack Power. “Our focus on making solar a viable and practical option for contractors and their customers led to several new products designed to simplify specification and save valuable installation time, as well as new battery technology intended to make storage-based solar electric systems more practical than ever.” SmartHarvest Solar Power Stations (SPS) are five complete systems for installers to deploy reliable, long-term lower-voltage DC power anywhere needed in the field, including agriculture, remote and wireless networking, security and video surveillance, LED lighting and intelligent traffic control applications. The systems are pre-configured in outdoor-rated National Electrical Manufacturers Association (NEMA) enclosures and include the enclosure, batteries, solar panels and all mounting hardware. FLEXpower Radian systems built around OutBack’s acclaimed Grid/Hybrid inverter/charger make residential and commercial installations easier than ever. The preconfigured system includes programming, charge control, networking and other balance-of-system components essential to a solar electric design. Contractors hang the pre-wired and tested product on the wall and simply connect the solar panels, batteries and backed-up loads panel, saving installation time of up to half a day. Nano-Carbon batteries combine the advantages of reliable, absorbed glass mat/valve-regulated lead-acid (VRLA) battery chemistries with cycling and performance characteristics approaching lithium-ion and other advanced energy storage. Most important, they are more fault-tolerant, designed to thrive in partial state-of-charge applications where a full refresh charge of the battery isn’t always possible (such as when there is insufficient sunlight), and offer up to 44 percent greater cycle life versus other traditional batteries. Extending battery life for real-world residential and light commercial conditions is essential to making energy storage a cost-effective, practical mainstream technology. OutBack’s new Nano-Carbons are a significant advance in the field. 
Continued Cerasuolo, “Most important is that these solutions are from a brand leader that contractors can specify with confidence. OutBack leads the industry in UL-1741 listed systems from end-to-end as well as the latest in NEC 2014-compliant rapid shutdown products. As noted by Greentech Media and others in the industry press, OutBack Power is now a leading global inverter brand; with its products on board all-in-one energy storage and management systems from Sonnenbatterie and others, they’re designed for tomorrow’s energy storage needs. We’re determined to apply that advantage today with these and other solar solutions that are as easy for contractors to deploy as they are advanced.” 
OutBack Power’s SmartHarvest Solar Power Stations will be available this fall, while the FLEXpower Radian and Nano-Carbon batteries are both currently shipping. For more information on these and other products from OutBack Power, visit booth No. 942 at the National Electrical Contractors Association Convention at Moscone Center South from Oct. 3 through Oct. 6, email sales@outbackpower.com or visit http://www.outbackpower.com . 
About OutBack Power Technologies 
OutBack Power Technologies, a member of The Alpha Group, is the leading designer and manufacturer of advanced power electronics for renewable energy, backup power and mobile applications. With an emphasis on product performance, OutBack has established itself as the product of choice in harsh environmental conditions and applications where product reliability is paramount. Whether the application is village micro-grids in Africa, rural electrification projects in Latin America, remote off-grid cabins in Alaska, or a suburban home in Southern California, OutBack Power Technologies has set the bar for delivering advanced power conversion electronics. For more information, please visit www.outbackpower.com . Contacts
